Dear Sir, IlTDIA OFFICE, WHITEHALL, S.' ,T .l. 18th July 1939. 19 JUIB59 6 I am desired to write to you on a matter connected with your visit to Koweit, for the purpose of making a film, in 1938. The authorities in the Persian Gulf have reported that on the strength of the recommendations in your favour from responsible people in this country you enjoyed the fullest assistance of the Sheikh of Koweit during your visit and that on its successful termination you promised him a copy of the film. It appears, however, that the Shaikh has not yet received the film, and the result has been to create a very bad impression on His Highness, who feels that he has been treated with discourtesy. This is felt to be most unfortunate, as you will no doubt agree. It is understood that the Shaikh would still greatly appreciate your sending him the film which you promised and I am to express the hope that you will be able to meet his wishes at your very early convenience. titleInfo.title: PZ 4121/1939 'Visit of one Niall Rankin to Kuwait: question of unfulfilled promise to send film of visit to Shaikh'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at inside back cover with 16; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file contains drafted, handwritten letters with annotations, as well as formal correspondence, sent between British officials in the Persian Gulf relating to the visit of Niall Rankin to Kuwait and his unfulfilled promise to send a copy of his film, much of which was set in Kuwait, to the Shaikh of Kuwait. The file also contains letters sent between officials in the India Office and Rankin regarding the issue.
